turns.speaker: PHILIP
turns.text: You're well built; how old are you?

turns.speaker: MELANIE
turns.text: Sixteen. Well, nearly sixteen.

turns.speaker: PHILIP
turns.text: I wanted my Leda to be a little girl. Leda and the swan. See?

turns.speaker: PHILIP
turns.text: Oh no you can't. Get on with the painting.

turns.speaker: MELANIE
turns.text: It's all right, Finn.

turns.speaker: ROBERT
turns.text: I appreciate you coming in so early.

turns.speaker: A.D.A. KELLY
turns.text: Judge Wakefield, it's an honor to handle it for you.  Consider it gone away.  She's a minor; it probably would've expunged on her 18th birthday anyway.

turns.speaker: ROBERT
turns.text: Still, this was a sensitive issue for me and I wanted to thank you personally.

turns.speaker: A.D.A. KELLY
turns.text: Like I said, open container, P.I., Misdemeanor possession.  Easy to make it disappear.  For you, poof, it's gone.

turns.speaker: A.D.A. KELLY
turns.text: One thing bothers me...  That kid they dropped off had coke and heroin in him.  Serious amounts.  He's lucky he lived.  So I gotta ask: what's your daughter on?

turns.speaker: ROBERT
turns.text: I don't know what you mean.

turns.speaker: A.D.A. KELLY
turns.text: I mean, did you ask her?  What kind of drugs has she tried?

turns.speaker: ROBERT
turns.text: I... I don't really know.

turns.speaker: A.D.A. KELLY
turns.text: Is she in any kind of therapy... professional help?

turns.speaker: ROBERT
turns.text: No, of course not.  She's one of the top students at her school.

turns.speaker: A.D.A. KELLY
turns.text: Well, I hope it stays that way.

turns.speaker: JAVIER
turns.text: Even if that were true, they're not going to come to your house where you're waiting for them.

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: He's right.  They'll do it when you're walking somewhere, make it look like street crime.

turns.speaker: JAVIER
turns.text: Anna.  What's wrong?  What do you want?

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: I can't find Manolo.

turns.speaker: JAVIER
turns.text: He's not here.

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: He never came home last night.  Was he with you?

turns.speaker: JAVIER
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: JAVIER
turns.text: What?  What is it?

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: It's very hard for me to come and tell you this.

turns.speaker: JAVIER
turns.text: Why does he need money?

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: He has debts.  He has gambling debts. He owes a lot of money.

turns.speaker: JAVIER
turns.text: How much?

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: Nine thousand dollars.

turns.speaker: JAVIER
turns.text: What is he planning on telling them?

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: Well, you know, he's going to say about Madrigal... and Salazar.

turns.speaker: JAVIER
turns.text: If Manolo hadn't gone and told them what he did then Salazar and Madrigal would never have been brought to justice.  He did a great thing for Tijuana.  He did a great thing for Mexico.

turns.speaker: ANNA
turns.text: I want to believe you.  I really do.

turns.speaker: JAVIER
turns.text: You will believe me, because it's true.

turns.speaker: ARNIE
turns.text: Helena, I'm so sorry --

turns.speaker: HELENA
turns.text: Arnie, thank God.

turns.speaker: ARNIE
turns.text: I understand.  You're upset.  You want to know what's going on.  That's good.

turns.speaker: HELENA
turns.text: Why are you talking like that?

turns.speaker: ARNIE
turns.text: Listen to me carefully.  First of all, Carl isn't here.  DEA's got him and they'll hang on to him until arraignment, which will probably be tomorrow.  So here you're wasting your time.  Are you with me?

turns.speaker: ARNIE
turns.text: Good.  From now on I want you to expect that every word you utter will be tape-recorded, that the movement of your lips is being read. Got it?

turns.speaker: HELENA
turns.text: Arnie, this is crazy.

turns.speaker: ARNIE
turns.text: Got it?  Good.  Do not discuss anything over the telephone.  Do not talk to the neighbors.  Stay out of your yard.

turns.speaker: HELENA
turns.text: What is he being charged with?

turns.speaker: ARNIE
turns.text: I don't know, but under no circumstances would I talk about it here.  I want you to go home and relax the best you can.  Continue your life as if nothing has happened. That is very important.

turns.speaker: HELENA
turns.text: Arnie, I feel like Alice stepping through the looking glass.

turns.speaker: ARNIE
turns.text: That's a very apt analogy, Helena. Now, go home and be with your children.

turns.speaker: HELENA
turns.text: I am on the board of my son's school. I had a fundraiser for A.L.V. in my front yard.  I have a right to know if my husband is a legitimate businessman.

turns.speaker: ARNIE
turns.text: Of course he is.  I've known him for twenty years and he doesn't jaywalk...

turns.speaker: HELENA
turns.text: If all our assets are frozen and our "sales force" has scattered...  How am I supposed to survive?  I'm giving birth in three months.  How do I get through this?

turns.speaker: ARNIE
turns.text: You're gonna get through it, but the first thing we do is get Michael Adler to represent Carl.  We get Adler and we beat this thing.

turns.speaker: HELENA
turns.text: How much do I pay him?

turns.speaker: ARNIE
turns.text: I suspect he'll accept his payment in publicity.

turns.speaker: ARNIE
turns.text: This place is swept twice a day.  I learned that in Miami in '85.  Then the U.S. shut down the whole Caribbean, but it's a big game of wack-a-mole.  Knock it down in Miami, it pops up here.  And San Diego is so much more relaxing.

turns.speaker: HELENA
turns.text: Arnie, I need money.  Somebody threatened my children.  They want a first payment of three million dollars.

turns.speaker: ARNIE
turns.text: Helena, if I had it I would give it to you, but I don't have that kind of money.

turns.speaker: HELENA
turns.text: Arnie, help me.  Doesn't anyone owe us money?

turns.speaker: ARNIE
turns.text: Yes, I told you before, there are people who owe you money but they're not paying.  There's too much heat on Carl.

turns.speaker: HELENA
turns.text: Please.  Tell me who Carl sells to.

turns.speaker: ARNIE
turns.text: Even if I knew I wouldn't tell you. You do not want to come into contact with these people.  Only Carl knows who they are.  That's his real asset. Ruiz doesn't know them.  They don't know Ruiz.  Church and State.

turns.speaker: HELENA
turns.text: What about legitimate businesses? We own a construction concern, real estate --

turns.speaker: ARNIE
turns.text: Laundromats for the washing of money. Unfortunately, Carl had only one successful business.

turns.speaker: HELENA
turns.text: Don't you have some good news?  Isn't there something positive you could say.

turns.speaker: HELENA
turns.text: Sometimes I wonder what I'll do if Carl doesn't get out.  I'm not very adept at being on my own.  I've always had a man in my life.  Always.

turns.speaker: ARNIE
turns.text: I remember when I first met you: little Helen Watts from the wrong side of somewhere.  I had a feeling even then that your survival instincts were pretty well honed.

turns.speaker: HELENA
turns.text: I'm glad you think so, but I'm picturing a debt-ridden, thirty-two year-old mother whose ex-husband is being compared to Pablo Escobar.  And I'm wondering who would want to be with someone like that?

turns.speaker: ARNIE
turns.text: That was a stupid thing you did. Incredibly stupid.

turns.speaker: HELENA
turns.text: I tried, Arnie.  And, I will continue to try.

turns.speaker: ARNIE
turns.text: Have you gone crazy?  You are not Carl.  You aren't as good as Carl.  They are moving the trial to a high security location.  The press has gone berserk.  The jury will be influenced.  Stay out of things. Let us try to win the case.

turns.speaker: HELENA
turns.text: That is going to be rather difficult when all the evidence is against us.

turns.speaker: ARNIE
turns.text: Helena, please.  This is out of your hands.

turns.speaker: HELENA
turns.text: I know I made things worse.  I know that and I'm sorry, but Arnie I need something from you.  Something only you can help me with.

turns.speaker: ARNIE
turns.text: Helena --

turns.speaker: HELENA
turns.text: I need an introduction to the Obregon Brothers.

turns.speaker: ARNIE
turns.text: I can't do that.

turns.speaker: HELENA
turns.text: Did you get it?

turns.speaker: ARNIE
turns.text: What are you thinking, calling me at home with a message like that?  You've compromised me and our relationship --

turns.speaker: HELENA
turns.text: It's the same stuff?  From the rainy day stash?

turns.speaker: ARNIE
turns.text: It's the same.  What happened to what they gave you?

turns.speaker: CARLOS
turns.text: It's Saturday, Arnie.  You work too hard.

turns.speaker: ARNIE
turns.text: Carl, I'm running late.  I'm coming right now --

turns.speaker: CARLOS
turns.text: Don't bother.

turns.speaker: ARNIE
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: CARLOS
turns.text: So Arnie, when were you going to tell me about the 3 million dollars we got in from San Francisco two days after I got arrested?

turns.speaker: ARNIE
turns.text: I was just waiting for the right time.

turns.speaker: CARLOS
turns.text: And you didn't feel like you could trust my wife with this news?

turns.speaker: ARNIE
turns.text: I just didn't want to take a chance. I didn't want to risk it.  It could have been frozen along with everything else.

turns.speaker: CARLOS
turns.text: You had it all figured out.  You move into my house.  You raise my kids.  You sleep with my wife.  It was a good plan, Arnie.

turns.speaker: ARNIE
turns.text: Carl, that's insane.

turns.speaker: CARLOS
turns.text: So my wife is lying?

turns.speaker: ARNIE
turns.text: Carl, think about it, if I was trying to rip you off, I would have left town after Ruiz was killed.  I wouldn't sit next to you in court listening to the dismissal.

turns.speaker: CARLOS
turns.text: Arnie, do think there's a difference between a reason and an excuse, because I don't think there is.

turns.speaker: ARNIE
turns.text: Carl --

turns.speaker: CARLOS
turns.text: Goodbye Arnie.

turns.speaker: BARBARA
turns.text: Like a Grateful Dead Concert.

turns.speaker: ROBERT
turns.text: Drugs begin pouring out of America into every other country in the world. Canada is completely overwhelmed.

turns.speaker: BARBARA
turns.text: So you know we put the case before the arbitration panel, none of whom had any expertise.  Superfund is just one of those words.  People stop paying attention.

turns.speaker: ROBERT
turns.text: That's frustrating.

turns.speaker: BARBARA
turns.text: It's so frustrating.

turns.speaker: ROBERT
turns.text: I think she's lying.

turns.speaker: BARBARA
turns.text: Me, too.

turns.speaker: ROBERT
turns.text: We'll ground her, clip her wings a bit.  School and scheduled activities and that's it until further notice. This has to be handled delicately. Dan Kelly, in the District Attorney's office, will probably help us out, quietly.  Christ, this could be embarrassing.

turns.speaker: BARBARA
turns.text: Honey, this is difficult, but we've all had our moments.  I tried --

turns.speaker: ROBERT
turns.text: Stop.  You experimented in college. I don't want to hear about that.

turns.speaker: BARBARA
turns.text: Should we take the quotes off experiment and call it what it is?

turns.speaker: ROBERT
turns.text: This is different.

turns.speaker: BARBARA
turns.text: Why?

turns.speaker: ROBERT
turns.text: To begin with, she's only sixteen years-old.

turns.speaker: BARBARA
turns.text: I think she has to find out for herself, on her own.  We have to allow her space --

turns.speaker: ROBERT
turns.text: Space for what?  To O.D. like that other kid?  I will not send the message that this type of behavior is okay with her parents.  Because it isn't.  Correct?

turns.speaker: BARBARA
turns.text: We don't want to push her away. These are growing experiences.

turns.speaker: ROBERT
turns.text: How long have you known?

turns.speaker: BARBARA
turns.text: Six months.  I found some marijuana, that's all.  And a little pipe about two inches long.  I talked with her. She said her friends smoked pot and drank --

turns.speaker: ROBERT
turns.text: Explain to me how you could think that I shouldn't know about this. Explain to me how this wouldn't be relevant to me.  As a parent.

turns.speaker: BARBARA
turns.text: She asked me not to.

turns.speaker: ROBERT
turns.text: I think we may have found our Mexican Drug Czar.  It's this General, Salazar.  At least I'll have somebody on the other side I can talk to.

turns.speaker: BARBARA
turns.text: Does this mean you're going to be gone more?

turns.speaker: BARBARA
turns.text: You might want to pencil in a little face-time with your daughter.

turns.speaker: ROBERT
turns.text: Barbara --

turns.speaker: BARBARA
turns.text: Because I'm at the edge of my capabilities, Robert.

turns.speaker: ROBERT
turns.text: The first thing we have to do is present a unified front.

turns.speaker: BARBARA
turns.text: If you start in on the war metaphors I'm going to drive this car into a fucking telephone pole.

turns.speaker: ROBERT
turns.text: Look, I'm as worried as you are --

turns.speaker: BARBARA
turns.text: No, I don't think so.  Leave me alone, give me money.  That's what I get from our daughter.  She has a way of shutting me out that seems very familiar.

turns.speaker: ROBERT
turns.text: Yeah, well, she has a way of self- medicating that probably seems familiar, too.

turns.speaker: BARBARA
turns.text: I'm not the one who has to have three scotches just to walk in the door and say hello.

turns.speaker: ROBERT
turns.text: I have a drink before dinner to take the edge off my day.  That's different.

turns.speaker: BARBARA
turns.text: Oh, it is?

turns.speaker: ROBERT
turns.text: Yeah, because the alternative is to be bored to death.

turns.speaker: BARBARA
turns.text: Should we bring the police into this?

turns.speaker: ROBERT
turns.text: No, not yet.

turns.speaker: ROBERT
turns.text: About the other night, I'm sorry.

turns.speaker: BARBARA
turns.text: Me, too.

turns.speaker: ROBERT
turns.text: God, I don't get it.  Are we supposed to say to ourselves, be prepared to lose her, be prepared to lose our child?  Why does this happen to someone? How does it happen?

turns.speaker: BARBARA
turns.text: I don't know.

turns.speaker: BARBARA
turns.text: My Leica's gone.

turns.speaker: ROBERT
turns.text: So's the video camera.

turns.speaker: BARBARA
turns.text: At least she's alive.

turns.speaker: BARBARA
turns.text: Where are you going?

turns.speaker: ROBERT
turns.text: She'll be at a pawn shop in an hour.

turns.speaker: CAROLINE
turns.text: Did you meet the President?

turns.speaker: BARBARA
turns.text: Honey, your father knows the President.

turns.speaker: BARBARA
turns.text: Czar for life, just like a real czar.

turns.speaker: CAROLINE
turns.text: That makes mom the Czarina.  I'm a Czarette.  Like Anastasia.

turns.speaker: CAROLINE
turns.text: None of my friends can fucking believe my dad is the actual Drug Czar.

turns.speaker: BARBARA
turns.text: Caroline --

turns.speaker: CAROLINE
turns.text: Sorry, but I mean, come on.

turns.speaker: CAROLINE
turns.text: Did you tell Dad?

turns.speaker: BARBARA
turns.text: Not yet.

turns.speaker: CAROLINE
turns.text: Are you going to?

turns.speaker: BARBARA
turns.text: I don't know.

turns.speaker: CAROLINE
turns.text: Is this bad for him?

turns.speaker: BARBARA
turns.text: What do you think?

turns.speaker: CAROLINE
turns.text: He didn't hang around us.  He's like one of those hippie kids.  I'm not part of that group.  It was a party in all these rooms.  His girlfriend who I barely know was completely hysterical... He's blue, he's puking... We didn't want to get in trouble, but what were we supposed to do?  I mean, what would you have done if you had been us?

turns.speaker: BARBARA
turns.text: How well do you know this boy, Seth, who was driving?  You know the police have charged him with a DUI and possession of marijuana.

turns.speaker: CAROLINE
turns.text: He's a friend.  He's also like the only one who was dealing with the situation.  He'd definitely had a few beers, but it's not like he wanted to drive.  We didn't know what else to do.  It wasn't my pot.

turns.speaker: CARL
turns.text: Hi.

turns.speaker: HELENA
turns.text: Hi.

turns.speaker: CARL
turns.text: What's up?

turns.speaker: HELENA
turns.text: Just watching you.

turns.speaker: CARL
turns.text: I got that.  How was your day?

turns.speaker: CARL
turns.text: You all right?

turns.speaker: HELENA
turns.text: I keep feeling like I'm forgetting something.

turns.speaker: CARL
turns.text: How's David?

turns.speaker: HELENA
turns.text: How's David? How's David? He's terrific, Carl.

turns.speaker: CARL
turns.text: Helena --

turns.speaker: HELENA
turns.text: We watched his father get dragged away by federal agents.  I don't even know how to begin to tell him where you are or when you're coming back... Or if you're coming back.

turns.speaker: CARL
turns.text: We'll get through this, I promise. I'll make it up to you --

turns.speaker: HELENA
turns.text: How?  Supportive letters from prison while I'm being kicked out of our home?  Do you have any idea what is happening out here?  Our credit cards are maxed. The people at the bank, you should see their faces when I walk in there. I have a letter from the government telling me that anything I sell from our house will be taken against an income tax lien.  Our friends are behaving like the crowd at a public hanging.  Nobody will help us.  Nobody will take us in.  Nobody wants anything to do with us.  So tell me, Carl, how you're gonna make it up to me.  Tell me again how we'll get through this, and maybe while you're at it you can put your hand up against the glass so we can have a tender moment of connection.

turns.speaker: CARL
turns.text: Helena --

turns.speaker: HELENA
turns.text: Tell me what to do, Carl.  I need guidance, not a fucking platitude.  I'm not bringing a child into the kind of life I grew up with.  I won't do it.  I want our life back.

turns.speaker: ROBERT
turns.text: What's it like?  Imagine you're being accosted by a swarm of beggars in the heart of Calcutta, except the beggars are wearing $1500 suits and they don't say "please" or "thank you."

turns.speaker: CAROLINE
turns.text: What about legalizing everything? Has anybody talked about that?

turns.speaker: ROBERT
turns.text: Fine -- legalization.  Okay, forgetting all of our international trade agreements, legalize everything today.  The Government inserts itself into all drug transactions.  The U.S. becomes a giant pharmacy.  Our borders are mobbed, lines of people from here to Europe wanting to smoke, snort and shoot themselves into oblivion.

turns.speaker: CAROLINE
turns.text: What if every country legalized at the same time?

turns.speaker: ROBERT
turns.text: Somehow, I don't see that happening.

turns.speaker: ROBERT
turns.text: As it happens, the President of the United States, my new boss, the leader of the free world, has me penciled in for some "face time".

turns.speaker: CAROLINE
turns.text: Will we get invited to the White House?

turns.speaker: ROBERT
turns.text: I don't know.

turns.speaker: CAROLINE
turns.text: How long's the job?

turns.speaker: ROBERT
turns.text: It's a presidential appointment so... until I quit or get fired.

turns.speaker: ROBERT
turns.text: Where is it?  Where are the drugs?  Where are they?

turns.speaker: CAROLINE
turns.text: Fuck you.  I wasn't doing anything. You're like the Gestapo.

turns.speaker: ROBERT
turns.text: Okay, young lady, that's it.

turns.speaker: CAROLINE
turns.text: Like I give a fuck.

turns.speaker: ROBERT
turns.text: What is wrong with you?  What?  You're going away.  You're getting help somewhere.

turns.speaker: CAROLINE
turns.text: You can't make me.

turns.speaker: ROBERT
turns.text: Oh, yes I can.

turns.speaker: SOCIAL WORKER
turns.text: ...How old are you?

turns.speaker: CAROLINE
turns.text: Sixteen

turns.speaker: SOCIAL WORKER
turns.text: Live with your parents?

turns.speaker: CAROLINE
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: SOCIAL WORKER
turns.text: Parents still together?

turns.speaker: CAROLINE
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: SOCIAL WORKER
turns.text: Do you work?

turns.speaker: CAROLINE
turns.text: I volunteer.  I read to blind people. One day a week for two hours.

turns.speaker: SOCIAL WORKER
turns.text: In school?

turns.speaker: CAROLINE
turns.text: Cincinnati Country Day.

turns.speaker: SOCIAL WORKER
turns.text: Private?

turns.speaker: CAROLINE
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: SOCIAL WORKER
turns.text: How are your grades?

turns.speaker: CAROLINE
turns.text: I'm third in my class.

turns.speaker: SOCIAL WORKER
turns.text: What's that mean?

turns.speaker: CAROLINE
turns.text: I get A's.  All A's.

turns.speaker: SOCIAL WORKER
turns.text: You do?  What else you do?

turns.speaker: CAROLINE
turns.text: I'm a National Merit Finalist.  I'm on the Hi-Q team and the Math team. I'm in the Spanish Club.  I'm a Thespian.  I'm Vice-President of my class.  I'm on the volleyball team.

turns.speaker: CAROLINE
turns.text: What are you doing?

turns.speaker: SETH
turns.text: Just watch.

turns.speaker: SETH
turns.text: Inhale the smoke and hold it.

turns.speaker: CAROLINE
turns.text: What is this, like freebase?

turns.speaker: SETH
turns.text: Not like.  It is.

turns.speaker: CAROLINE
turns.text: Ach, that's what I'm talking about. Sarcasm.  Always fucking sarcasm. You're afraid and you think if you admit it people will think you're weak or won't like you --

turns.speaker: SETH
turns.text: We live our lives by these unspoken rules that are handed to us.

turns.speaker: CAROLINE
turns.text: Are you kidding...  I'm staying with you --

turns.speaker: SETH
turns.text: He's gonna fucking die right here on the kitchen floor --

turns.speaker: SETH
turns.text: You know my dad takes eight red cold pills every day?  He and my mom have cocktail hour every night, from six to seven, set your clock, two bourbons --

turns.speaker: CAROLINE
turns.text: Maybe we could show up and smoke a little rock with them to unwind --

turns.speaker: SETH
turns.text: Yeah, then some dope to take the edge off at the end of a long day.

turns.speaker: CAROLINE
turns.text: Have you done your homework, honey?

turns.speaker: SETH
turns.text: Yes, mom --

turns.speaker: CAROLINE
turns.text: Then here's a little bump.

turns.speaker: SETH
turns.text: Did Courtney Love play Nancy in Syd and Nancy?

turns.speaker: CAROLINE
turns.text: I think so.  If she didn't she should have.  I've only got maybe an hour.  Then volleyball practice is over and I have to be home.

turns.speaker: SETH
turns.text: Why?  Nobody's there.

turns.speaker: CASTRO
turns.text: No telltales.  Nothing to read. Not touching my face.  Not even blinking.  No giveaways.  How're you feeling?

turns.speaker: GORDON
turns.text: I feel good.

turns.speaker: CASTRO
turns.text: No more pissant basin league bullshit for us, hunh?

turns.speaker: GORDON
turns.text: Nope.

turns.speaker: GORDON
turns.text: Chill out --

turns.speaker: CASTRO
turns.text: It's a funny fuckin' joke and it's quick.  Why do women wear makeup and perfume?

turns.speaker: CASTRO
turns.text: Move 'em to Texas, fry 'em up.

turns.speaker: GORDON
turns.text: We got you on tape making the deal. We got you bragging about the quality. We got you bragging about your business.  We got you.

turns.speaker: GORDON
turns.text: That's a big word for a fisherman.

turns.speaker: CASTRO
turns.text: Who do you work for?

turns.speaker: CASTRO
turns.text: They're whispering.  I can't hear them, but I know it.  I smell conspiracy.  I feel the lie vibrating out of the home.

turns.speaker: GORDON
turns.text: She ain't in on it.

turns.speaker: CASTRO
turns.text: I have dreams about this, actual dreams about busting the top people, the rich people, the white people.

turns.speaker: GORDON
turns.text: I'm telling you, she doesn't know shit.

turns.speaker: CASTRO
turns.text: She knows Arnie Metzger.

turns.speaker: GORDON
turns.text: So does half of San Diego.

turns.speaker: CASTRO
turns.text: You want to make a wager on this?

turns.speaker: GORDON
turns.text: You should see little Montel play. Little Montel is the next Maradona.

turns.speaker: CASTRO
turns.text: Maradona is a cokehead.  Hand of God, my ass.  We're wasting our time here.

turns.speaker: GORDON
turns.text: He won.  He was a winner.  That bothers you.

turns.speaker: CASTRO
turns.text: Winners don't do coke.  Or haven't you been reading the bumper stickers?

turns.speaker: GORDON
turns.text: Are you getting this on tape?

turns.speaker: CASTRO
turns.text: I love my job.  I love it.  The next time I'm having a bad day you gotta remind me of right now and I'll get over it.

turns.speaker: GORDON
turns.text: What do we do?

turns.speaker: CASTRO
turns.text: I don't know.

turns.speaker: GORDON
turns.text: What do you think she wants?

turns.speaker: CASTRO
turns.text: She's your girlfriend.  Open it, talk about your kids.

turns.speaker: CASTRO
turns.text: Remember when we sat on that mob guy, that chef, for like six months?

turns.speaker: GORDON
turns.text: Oh, man, I've never eaten so good in my life.  Why don't you develop a useful skill?

turns.speaker: CASTRO
turns.text: Yeah, like turning into a beautiful woman.

turns.speaker: CLERK
turns.text: What do you think it is?

turns.speaker: ROBERT
turns.text: Depends who it's from.

turns.speaker: CLERK
turns.text: Your friends at Warren, Putnam and Hudson.

turns.speaker: ROBERT
turns.text: You can learn a lot about somebody from this stuff.  Three categories: you like me, you hate me, you want something from me.  Definitely third category.

turns.speaker: CLERK
turns.text: What would a law firm want from the new drug Czar?

turns.speaker: ROBERT
turns.text: Depends on the state.

turns.speaker: CLERK
turns.text: Arizona.

turns.speaker: ROBERT
turns.text: Medicinal marijuana initiative.  Or am I being cynical?

turns.speaker: HELENA
turns.text: I'll put this in the back.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: No --

turns.speaker: HELENA
turns.text: All the professionals keep them in the trunk.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Not Tiger Woods.

turns.speaker: HELENA
turns.text: Especially Tiger Woods.  ...Actually, he keeps his on the back seat.

turns.speaker: HELENA
turns.text: David --

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: We're playing!

turns.speaker: HELENA
turns.text: Women's room, stall two.  Should we stop for ice-cream?

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Yeah!

turns.speaker: FRANCISCO
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: HELENA
turns.text: I'm on a special phone, may I speak freely?

turns.speaker: FRANCISCO
turns.text: You may speak.

turns.speaker: HELENA
turns.text: I have a job for you and I don't have much time.

turns.speaker: FRANCISCO
turns.text: You were followed by the police, but they won't hear us over the children. I want to use a bomb.

turns.speaker: HELENA
turns.text: You're kidding.  Can't you shoot him or something?

turns.speaker: FRANCISCO
turns.text: I don't really like guns.  You shoot someone in the head three times and some doctor will keep them alive.

turns.speaker: HELENA
turns.text: When will you do it?

turns.speaker: FRANCISCO
turns.text: I don't know.  Eduardo Ruiz is the only real witness against Carl.  The security is very tight.  There may not be a way.

turns.speaker: HELENA
turns.text: There's always a way.  If people get to the Pope or the President, you can get to him.

turns.speaker: FRANCISCO
turns.text: They're going to walk right past me.

turns.speaker: HELENA
turns.text: What are you?  A mouse?  Get out of the car and do it.  This is your chance.

turns.speaker: RUIZ
turns.text: So, it's worth the wait, right? What can I do?  Rent a Huey?  Have an airlift?  It's not like you can put it in a condom up some mule's asshole, right?  How many peasants would that take?  A line stretching from here to Mexico City --

turns.speaker: GORDON
turns.text: Nobody said shit, Eduardo --

turns.speaker: GORDON
turns.text: You planning on going somewhere, Eduardo?  You don't like it here? This is the best situation you're going to have for a long, long time.

turns.speaker: RUIZ
turns.text: I am a legitimate business.  Fishing boats.  Tuna.  Check it out.  Tax records, everything --

turns.speaker: GORDON
turns.text: Listen you motherfucker, you tried to kill me with a fucking cannon.

turns.speaker: RUIZ
turns.text: You can't visit me here.  I want my lawyer.

turns.speaker: GORDON
turns.text: The amount of coke we got on you means capital punishment in some states.

turns.speaker: GORDON
turns.text: One chance here, Eduardo.  Make us believe you got a boss.  No boss, it's all on you.

turns.speaker: RUIZ
turns.text: It's a death sentence.  I'll never make it to the trial.

turns.speaker: GORDON
turns.text: We can protect you.

turns.speaker: RUIZ
turns.text: Carlos, I mean Carl, started out in the family connection business: real estate in Tijuana, fishing boats out of Ensenada, hydroponic raspberries. He met up with the Obregon brothers of the Tijuana Cartel who were interested in two things: entering society and using his fishing boats.

turns.speaker: GORDON
turns.text: So you pay off our customs officials?

turns.speaker: RUIZ
turns.text: In Mexico law enforcement is an entrepreneurial activity, this is not so true for the USA.  Using regression analysis we made a study of the customs lanes at the border and calculated the odds of a search.  The odds are not high, and we found variables that reduce the odds.  We hire drivers with nothing to lose.  Then we throw a lot of product at the problem.  Some get stopped.  Enough get through.  It's not difficult.

turns.speaker: GORDON
turns.text: This attitude's not gonna help him any, is it?

turns.speaker: RUIZ
turns.text: I got greedy.  I decided to bring a little in on my own and somebody tipped you off.  That was my mistake. Carl would never be so stupid.

turns.speaker: GORDON
turns.text: He hired you.  That was a mistake.

turns.speaker: RUIZ
turns.text: Carl and I were friends from childhood.  He was loyal, that's not a mistake.

turns.speaker: RUIZ
turns.text: This is ridiculous.  Why is there no elevator?

turns.speaker: GORDON
turns.text: When the DEA gets into the narcotics business, then we'll stay at the Four Seasons.

turns.speaker: RUIZ
turns.text: You expect me to be grateful for spending the rest of my life looking over my shoulder.

turns.speaker: GORDON
turns.text: That thought makes me feel awful.

turns.speaker: RUIZ
turns.text: Can't you for a second imagine none of this had happened?  That my drugs had gone through.  What would have been the harm?  A few people get high who are getting high anyway. Your partner is still alive.  We avoid having breakfast together. Don't you see this means nothing? That your whole life is pointless?

turns.speaker: GORDON
turns.text: You're breaking my heart.

turns.speaker: RUIZ
turns.text: The worst thing about you, Monty, is you realize the futility of what you're doing and you do it anyway. I wish you could see how transparent you are.  This food tastes like shit.

turns.speaker: GORDON
turns.text: So go shower already.

turns.speaker: RUIZ
turns.text: You only got to me because you were tipped off by the Juarez Cartel, who's trying to break into Tijuana. You're helping them.  You work for a drug dealer too, Monty.

turns.speaker: SALAZAR
turns.text: I want to know who is responsible for this treatment.

turns.speaker: GUARD
turns.text: Yes, sir!

turns.speaker: SALAZAR
turns.text: We aren't barbarians.

turns.speaker: GUARD
turns.text: Yes, sir!

turns.speaker: SALAZAR
turns.text: Bring this man a change of good clothes.  Has he eaten?

turns.speaker: GUARD
turns.text: I don't know, sir.

turns.speaker: SALAZAR
turns.text: You will dine with me from now on.

turns.speaker: HELENA
turns.text: Yes, he threatened to kill my five year-old son.  I was under the impression I would be meeting Juan Obregon.

turns.speaker: MARQUEZ
turns.text: No, this is not possible.  And I thank you for coming down here, though I suspect it's been a pointless journey.

turns.speaker: HELENA
turns.text: Why do you say that, Mr. Marquez?

turns.speaker: MARQUEZ
turns.text: I hear these stories.  Your husband in jail.  His business in chaos. Various people fighting over the scraps.

turns.speaker: HELENA
turns.text: My husband is the victim of an informer in your organization, not ours.

turns.speaker: MARQUEZ
turns.text: That is not true, Mrs. Ayala.  Your route is compromised.  Perhaps it is time for me to deal with other distributors in California.

turns.speaker: HELENA
turns.text: I don't think you're going to do that.

turns.speaker: MARQUEZ
turns.text: You don't?  Listen to this woman in a man's world, a very violent world.

turns.speaker: HELENA
turns.text: There are plenty of other suppliers in Mexico.

turns.speaker: MARQUEZ
turns.text: But not in whose interest it is to help you out of debt.

turns.speaker: HELENA
turns.text: My husband had been working on something he called, The Project for the Children.  Are you aware of this?

turns.speaker: MARQUEZ
turns.text: I don't know.  Perhaps I remember something.

turns.speaker: HELENA
turns.text: We have the ability to change the color, odor, and physical property of cocaine.

turns.speaker: MARQUEZ
turns.text: You want to smuggle narcotics in Mr. Espastico Jacobo.  That's nothing new.

turns.speaker: HELENA
turns.text: Not in...

turns.speaker: HELENA
turns.text: Every part, from his ears to his accessory belt, is high-impact, pressure-molded cocaine.  Odorless. Undetectable by dogs.  Undetectable by anyone.

turns.speaker: MARQUEZ
turns.text: I don't believe you.

turns.speaker: MARQUEZ
turns.text: You first.

turns.speaker: HELENA
turns.text: I'm six months pregnant.  I won't do it.

turns.speaker: MARQUEZ
turns.text: Fine, then we don't have deal.

turns.speaker: HELENA
turns.text: Fine, then we don't have a deal.

turns.speaker: MARQUEZ
turns.text: That's good coke.

turns.speaker: HELENA
turns.text: It should be... It's yours.  I want our debt forgiven.  I want to be the exclusive distributor of Obregon Brothers Cocaine for the United States.  And I want the principle witness against my husband, Eduardo Ruiz, killed.

turns.speaker: MARQUEZ
turns.text: Perhaps... Perhaps... I'm afraid I must first ask you to pass a test. I asked the same of your husband and he succeeded with flying colors.

turns.speaker: MARQUEZ
turns.text: Take this back with you.  Deliver it safely to Tigrillo in San Diego and we have a deal.

turns.speaker: HELENA
turns.text: That's crazy.  My husband is on trial for smuggling.

turns.speaker: MARQUEZ
turns.text: Exactly, and this is how I know I'm not getting into business with the U.S. Government.

turns.speaker: HELENA
turns.text: You will help me with my other problem.

turns.speaker: MARQUEZ
turns.text: Deliver that safely to Tigrillo in San Diego.  And we have a deal.

turns.speaker: MANOLO
turns.text: Wasn't that General Salazar?

turns.speaker: JAVIER
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: MANOLO
turns.text: What's he doing up here?

turns.speaker: JAVIER
turns.text: I don't know.  Something.

turns.speaker: JAVIER
turns.text: Relax.  If they were going to kill us they would have done it in the desert.

turns.speaker: MANOLO
turns.text: They wouldn't do it in front of all these people.  They'd send someone later, when we're alone.

turns.speaker: JAVIER
turns.text: If you want her to stay out of it, then stop telling her everything. You should learn how to keep a secret.

turns.speaker: MANOLO
turns.text: She's nosy.  She hears me on the telephone.

turns.speaker: JAVIER
turns.text: Anyway, I don't think we'll ever see them again.  Everything's back to normal.

turns.speaker: MANOLO
turns.text: Please.  Filing a report will not help you find your car.

turns.speaker: JAVIER
turns.text: The police won't find your car.

turns.speaker: MANOLO
turns.text: This is fucking crazy.  Instead of killing us, he sends us on a suicide mission.  Do you know who Frankie Flowers is?  He's a psycho-cokehead- hitman.  A faggot.  He's killed fucking who knows how many people. You'd need half the force to get close to him.  And you can't get their help because he lives in fucking San Diego.

turns.speaker: JAVIER
turns.text: Then I guess I'm going by myself.
